subject: Re: [junit] Difference of Assert in junit.org and junit.framework
msgSnippet: Tom, The org.junit packages contain JUnit 4, while the junit.framework packages contain JUnit 3.  JUnit 4 is a complete, self-contained implementation, which
messageBody:
Tom,

The org.junit packages contain JUnit 4, while the junit.framework
packages contain JUnit 3. JUnit 4 is a complete, self-contained
implementation, which only relies on the JUnit 3 code when necessary
for backwards or forwards compatibility. The Assert class is pretty
much the only class that survived the 3-to-4 migration with few
changes, but there are some:

- failed asserts throw AssertionError instead of AssertionFailedError,
giving users the option to use Java's native assert keyword.
- a few new methods, including assertArrayEquals and assertThat

Thanks,

David Saff

On 8/20/07, Tom Hsu <tomhsu@...> wrote:
> junit.org.Assert and junit.framework.Assert seems to offer the same
> set of functionalities. Can someone explain why they are duplicated?
> What are the intent of having junit.org vs. junit.framework?
>
